title: What is the likelihood that climate change can be averted without developed nations’ government involvement? - Quora

response.answer_text: It can’t be averted. Developed nations or not. I live on the coast at the mouth of a river. While we are unable to measure any changes in sea level and the ‘best’ science suggests a rise of 500 50 600 mm by 2100 which will see water at our front door. I would be lot more concerned if I lived in a large low lying coastal city. The logistics are mind boggling. For us in small community where most are totally self sufficient it is more of an inconvenience. If, a big if, the sea rises we will simply move.

The answer is zilch. Climate change is what nature does and always has done and she doesn’t care what humans do, think or say because we cannot dictate to nature how she will act. It’s as simple a that. We can however avert the disease and filth experienced in places like LA and San Francisco by revoking Democrat policies and return to common sense legislation.
Even with developed nations on board the current policy trajectory is insufficient and leads to +3.3C of warming by 2100. Home | Climate Action Tracker
